A test case used in the sorting problem is a list of any comparable data. Usually the elements of the list are of the same type (integers, real numbers, strings, ...).

In this project a test case is a one-dimensional fixed-sized array of integers. The aim of the algorithm is to sort this array (either in-place or out-of-place, it is only important that the sorted elements are written in the same input array at the end). For the Java programs the test case is declared with

int[] arrayToSort = new int[n];
where n is the size of an array to be sorted.
